Key Match Events: Pakistan won the toss and elected to bowl first.
Mohammad Amir starred early with the ball, contributing to quick wickets.
The run out of Nicholas Kirton was crucial for Pakistan.
Aaron Johnson played some powerful shots but Canada fell short by 15 runs.
Pakistan chased 107 and won by 7 wickets.
Fakhar Zaman completed his 50 while Rizwan stitched together a vital stand.
Usman Khan hit the winning runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Babar Azam said it was a good win and credited the boys, noting the team bowled well in the Powerplay.
Saad Bin Zafar, Canada's captain, said the result was disappointing and acknowledged the opposition bowlers bowled well.
Mohammad Amir was named Man of the Match and praised his performance and adaptability to conditions.
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam said they could have won the game quicker and improved their net run rate.
Saad Bin Zafar applauded Aaron Johnson's innings and noted the run out of Nicholas Kirton was crucial.
Mohammad Amir said it was an important win and another one might help them in the Super 8.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shaheen Afridi was far from his best again.
Dilon Heyliger used his height well to pick up wickets.
The pitch was described as a two-paced wicket, making it challenging for both teams.
